value.title: Power BI Walkthrough: Analysis Services Live Connect
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to setup a live connection to Analysis Services, or Azure Analysis Services, in Power BI Desktop. This also involves getting things working with the On-Premises Data Gateway.  What is a gateway - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WJ5Y4FjkWZw Authentication with AS Live Connections

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI

value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Variable TOP N Filter)

value.title: Power BI Get Data from Google Sheets
value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. The feature is still preview (Beta) but it is worthwhile looking at how it works in a quick article and video. Study more from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/power-bi-get-data-from-google-sheets

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 dataâ€‹
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Dataâ€‹

value.title: Create dashboards in Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft Power BI dashboards are different than Power BI reports. Dashboards allow report consumers to create a single artifact of directed data that is personalized just for them.  Dashboards can be comprised of pinned visuals that are taken from different reports. Where a Power BI report uses data from a single dataset, a Power BI dashboard can contain visuals from different datasets.

value.title: Explore fundamentals of data visualization
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamental principles of analytical data modeling and data visualization, using Microsoft Power BI as a platform to explore these principles in action.

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the userâ€™s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).
